standard.name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
standard.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework provides a policy framework of computer security guidance for organizations to assess and improve their ability to prevent, detect, and respond to cyber attacks.

controls.name: Organizational mission is understood
controls.description: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management.

controls.name: Internal and external stakeholders are understood
controls.description: Internal and external stakeholders are understood, and their needs and expectations regarding cybersecurity risk management are understood and considered.

controls.name: Legal and regulatory requirements are understood
controls.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity – including privacy and civil liberties obligations – are understood and managed.

controls.name: Critical objectives and dependencies are understood
controls.description: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that external stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated.

controls.name: Outcomes and priorities are established
controls.description: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are understood and communicated.

controls.name: Risk management objectives are established
controls.description: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

controls.name: Risk appetite and tolerance are established
controls.description: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained.

controls.name: Risk management activities are integrated
controls.description: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes.

controls.name: Strategic direction is established
controls.description: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated.

controls.name: Organizational leadership is responsible
controls.description: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving.

controls.name: Roles and responsibilities are established
controls.description: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced.

controls.name: Adequate resources are allocated
controls.description: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies.

controls.name: Cybersecurity is included in HR practices
controls.description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices.

controls.name: Policy is established based on context
controls.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced.

controls.name: Policy is reviewed and updated
controls.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission.

controls.name: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management program
controls.description: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

controls.name: Suppliers are identified and prioritized
controls.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally.

controls.name: Supply chain risk is integrated
controls.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes.

controls.name: Suppliers are assessed
controls.description: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality.

controls.name: Supply chain requirements are established
controls.description: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties.

controls.name: Hardware inventory is maintained
controls.description: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained.

controls.name: Software inventory is maintained
controls.description: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained.

controls.name: Network communication flows are documented
controls.description: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external network data flows are maintained.

controls.name: External systems are catalogued
controls.description: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained.

controls.name: Assets are prioritized
controls.description: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission.

controls.name: Data inventory is maintained
controls.description: Inventories of data and corresponding metadata for designated data types are maintained.

controls.name: Systems and assets are managed
controls.description: Systems, hardware, software, and services are managed throughout their life cycles.

controls.name: Vulnerabilities are identified
controls.description: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded.

controls.name: Threat intelligence is received
controls.description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

controls.name: Threats are identified
controls.description: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded.

controls.name: Potential impacts are identified
controls.description: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded.

controls.name: Threats and vulnerabilities are used for risk
controls.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization.

controls.name: Risk responses are chosen
controls.description: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated.

controls.name: Changes and exceptions are managed
controls.description: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked.

controls.name: Processes for receiving disclosure are established
controls.description: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established.

controls.name: Severity of events is assessed
controls.description: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use.

controls.name: Critical suppliers are assessed
controls.description: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition.

controls.name: Improvements are identified from evaluations
controls.description: Improvements are identified from evaluations.

controls.name: Improvements are identified from tests
controls.description: Improvements are identified from security tests and exercises, including those done in coordination with suppliers and relevant third parties.

controls.name: Improvements are identified from incidents
controls.description: Improvements are identified from execution of operational processes, procedures, and activities.

controls.name: Incident response plans are incorporated
controls.description: Incident response plans and other cybersecurity plans that affect operations are established, communicated, maintained, and improved.

controls.name: Identities and credentials are managed
controls.description: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization.
controls.subcategory: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

controls.name: Identities are proofed and bound
controls.description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions.
controls.subcategory: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

controls.name: Users and services are authenticated
controls.description: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated.
controls.subcategory: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

controls.name: Identity assertions are protected
controls.description: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified.
controls.subcategory: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

controls.name: Access permissions are managed
controls.description: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.
controls.subcategory: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

controls.name: Physical access is managed
controls.description: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk.
controls.subcategory: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

controls.name: Personnel are provided awareness and training
controls.description: Personnel are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

controls.name: Individuals in specialized roles are trained
controls.description: Individuals in specialized roles are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

controls.name: Data-at-rest is protected
controls.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected.

controls.name: Data-in-transit is protected
controls.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected.

controls.name: Data-in-use is protected
controls.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected.

controls.name: Backups are created and protected
controls.description: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested.

controls.name: Configuration management is established
controls.description: Configuration management practices are established and applied.

controls.name: Software is maintained
controls.description: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk.

controls.name: Hardware is maintained
controls.description: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk.

controls.name: Log records are generated
controls.description: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring.

controls.name: Installation of software is controlled
controls.description: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented.

controls.name: Secure software development practices
controls.description: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle.

controls.name: Networks are protected
controls.description: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage.

controls.name: Technology assets are protected
controls.description: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats.

controls.name: Resilience mechanisms are implemented
controls.description: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.

controls.name: Adequate resource capacity is maintained
controls.description: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained.

controls.name: Networks are monitored
controls.description: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

controls.name: Physical environment is monitored
controls.description: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events.

controls.name: Personnel activity is monitored
controls.description: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

controls.name: External service provider activity is monitored
controls.description: External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

controls.name: Computing hardware is monitored
controls.description: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

controls.name: Potentially adverse events are analyzed
controls.description: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities.

controls.name: Events are correlated
controls.description: Information is correlated from multiple sources.

controls.name: Impact of events is estimated
controls.description: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood.

controls.name: Information on adverse events is provided
controls.description: Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools.

controls.name: Threat intelligence is integrated
controls.description: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis.

controls.name: Incidents are declared
controls.description: Incidents are declared when adverse events meet the defined incident criteria.

controls.name: Incident management plan is executed
controls.description: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared.

controls.name: Incident reports are triaged
controls.description: Incident reports are triaged and validated.

controls.name: Incidents are categorized and prioritized
controls.description: Incidents are categorized and prioritized.

controls.name: Incidents are escalated or elevated
controls.description: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed.

controls.name: Incident criteria are applied
controls.description: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied.

controls.name: Analysis is performed
controls.description: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident.

controls.name: Actions taken are recorded
controls.description: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded, and the records' integrity and provenance are preserved.

controls.name: Incident data is collected and preserved
controls.description: Incident data and metadata are collected, and their integrity and provenance are preserved.

controls.name: Incident's magnitude is estimated
controls.description: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated.

controls.name: Internal stakeholders are notified
controls.description: Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents.

controls.name: Information is shared with stakeholders
controls.description: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders.

controls.name: Incidents are contained
controls.description: Incidents are contained.

controls.name: Incidents are eradicated
controls.description: Incidents are eradicated.

controls.name: Recovery plan is executed
controls.description: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process.

controls.name: Recovery actions are selected
controls.description: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed.

controls.name: Integrity of backups is verified
controls.description: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration.

controls.name: Critical functions are considered
controls.description: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms.

controls.name: Recovery verification is performed
controls.description: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed.

controls.name: End of recovery is declared
controls.description: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed.

controls.name: Recovery activities are communicated
controls.description: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders.

controls.name: Public updates are shared
controls.description: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging.
